snippet: Cecilia Chang, a dean at St. John’s University, was a complicated figure, one whose descent from beauty-parlor optimism to suicide took less than two days.
abstract: Cecilia Chang, former St John's University dean embroiled in fraud scandal, is found dead of apparent suicide after testifying at her corruption trial; was indicted for stealing money from university and using foreign students as servants; her death marks end of a contradictory and complicated figure whose renowned fund-raising work stands in sharp contrast to her alleged involvement with criminals and links to her first husband's murder.

byline.original: By WILLIAM K. RASHBAUM, WENDY RUDERMAN and MOSI SECRET
byline.contributor: Kitty Bennett and Jeffrey E. Singer contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Cecilia Chang, a dean at St. John’s University, was a complicated figure, one whose descent from beauty-parlor optimism to suicide took less than two days.

headline.seo: For St. John’s Dean, a Quick Descent From Smiles to Suicide
headline.main: Fallen Dean’s Life, Contradictory to Its Grisly End
headline.print_headline: Fallen Dean’s Life, Contradictory to Its Grisly End
